name: src/api/choice.js
choice
description: Sample a single element from an array.

name: src/api/randfloat.js
randfloat
description:
Returns a double in interval [i, j[ (i included, j excluded)
according to a uniform distribution.

return.description:
A double in the interval [i, j[ taken uniformly at
random.

name: src/api/randint.js
randint
description:
Returns an integer in interval [i, j[ (i included, j excluded)
according to a uniform distribution.

return.description:
An integer in the interval [i, j[ taken uniformly at
random.

name: src/api/random.js
random
description: Returns a double in the interval [0, 1) using JavaScript Math.random().

name: src/api/randrange.js
randrange
description: Return a randomly selected element from range(start, stop, step).

name: src/api/sample.js
src/api/shuffle.js
src/index.js
src/kernel/_choice.js
_choice
description: Builds a choice function given a randint function.

name: src/kernel/_fisheryates.js
src/kernel/_randfloat.js
_randfloat
description: Builds a randfloat function given a random number generator.

params.name: random
params.description:
A function taking no arguments that returns a
double uniformly at random in the interval [0, 1).

name: src/kernel/_randint.js
_randint
description: Builds a randint function given a random number generator.

params.name: random
params.description:
A function taking no arguments that returns a
double uniformly at random in the interval [0, 1).

name: src/kernel/_shuffle.js
_shuffle
description: Shuffle array by sampling the complete array.

content:
:game_die: [@aureooms/js-random](https://aureooms.github.io/js-random) ==


© xkcd.com

Randomness algorithms for JavaScript. See [docs](https://aureooms.github.io/js-random). Parent is [@aureooms/js-algorithms](https://aureooms.github.io/js-algorithms). ```js import { randint , // randint(i, j) -> [i, j[ \cap ZZ randfloat , // randfloat(i, j) -> [i, j[ sample , // /!\ in-place shuffle , // /!\ in-place } from '@aureooms/js-random' ; ``` [![License](https://img.shields.io/github/license/aureooms/js-random.svg)](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/aureooms/js-random/main/LICENSE) [![Version](https://img.shields.io/npm/v/@aureooms/js-random.svg)](https://www.npmjs.org/package/@aureooms/js-random) [![Tests](https://img.shields.io/github/workflow/status/aureooms/js-random/ci:test?event=push&label=tests)](https://github.com/aureooms/js-random/actions/workflows/ci:test.yml?query=branch:main) [![Dependencies](https://img.shields.io/david/aureooms/js-random.svg)](https://david-dm.org/aureooms/js-random) [![Dev dependencies](https://img.shields.io/david/dev/aureooms/js-random.svg)](https://david-dm.org/aureooms/js-random?type=dev) [![GitHub issues](https://img.shields.io/github/issues/aureooms/js-random.svg)](https://github.com/aureooms/js-random/issues) [![Downloads](https://img.shields.io/npm/dm/@aureooms/js-random.svg)](https://www.npmjs.org/package/@aureooms/js-random) [![Code issues](https://img.shields.io/codeclimate/issues/aureooms/js-random.svg)](https://codeclimate.com/github/aureooms/js-random/issues) [![Code maintainability](https://img.shields.io/codeclimate/maintainability/aureooms/js-random.svg)](https://codeclimate.com/github/aureooms/js-random/trends/churn) [![Code coverage (cov)](https://img.shields.io/codecov/c/gh/aureooms/js-random/main.svg)](https://codecov.io/gh/aureooms/js-random) [![Code technical debt](https://img.shields.io/codeclimate/tech-debt/aureooms/js-random.svg)](https://codeclimate.com/github/aureooms/js-random/trends/technical_debt) [![Documentation](https://aureooms.github.io/js-random/badge.svg)](https://aureooms.github.io/js-random/source.html) [![Package size](https://img.shields.io/bundlephobia/minzip/@aureooms/js-random)](https://bundlephobia.com/result?p=@aureooms/js-random)
name: ./README.md
package.json
./doc/manual/installation.md
content:
# Installation
Can be managed using
[jspm](http://jspm.io)
or [npm](https://github.com/npm/npm).

### jspm
```terminal
jspm install npm:@aureooms/js-random
```

### npm
```terminal
npm install @aureooms/js-random --save
```
